data.title: Donald Petrie
data.text:
American actor and film director

For the New Zealand botanist, see Donald Petrie (botanist).

Donald Mark Petrie[1] (born April 2, 1954)[1] is an American film director and actor.

Life and career

[edit]

Petrie was born in New York City, New York, the son of Dorothea (n√©e Grundy), a television producer, actor, and novelist, and Daniel Petrie, a director.[1][2] He is the brother of writer Daniel Petrie Jr. Petrie began his entertainment career as an actor, having trained and graduated from California State Northridge as a theatre major. Donald soon was appearing in many television episodes. In 1980, Donald decided to shift his focus to directing when he was accepted as a Fellow at the American Film Institute.[3]

Petrie has acted and guest-starred on television programs since 1976.
